note.p: Mauritian-born physician. Studied medicine in Paris. Worked for the Red Cross during the Franco-Prussian War, 1870. Dedicated his doctoral thesis to his mentor and friend Charles Édouard Brown-Séquard. MD, University of London. Professor of experimental medicine at the London School of Medicine for Women, 1874. Worked in Claude Bernard’s laboratory, 1875. Secretary to Brown-Séquard in Paris, London, and America.
